security: This memo details the procurement and use of a false passport for an agent, ARSTALE-1, including specific passport numbers, itinerary details, and alias information. Releasing these details could compromise the agent's identity and any related operations. Directly quoting: 'Transmitted herewith for use as outlined in Reference are the following two documents issued in alias for ARSTALE-1:(Nicaragua) Ordinary Passport No. 85701 and U.S. Immigration and Naturalization Form I-94...Also furnished herewith is a travel itinerary...' revealing methods of agent support and potential risk to sources and methods.
summary: A memo transmitting an alias passport and immigration form for ARSTALE-1, outlining travel plans and precautions for obtaining an Argentine visa without compromising the operation.
summary_one_paragraph: This memo, dated April 12, 1963, from the Chief of CI/SA/Argentina to a colleague, transmits a Nicaraguan passport and U.S. immigration form issued in alias for ARSTALE-1 for operational use. It details the travel itinerary that ARSTALE-1 should follow when applying for an Argentine visa in New York and specifies precautions to maintain the validity of the documentation, including the potential need for revalidations handled by TOD/AD. The memo emphasizes the limitations of the documentation due to its rapid procurement and the lack of BIOXYGENESIS assistance, stressing that any deviations from the planned travel require SED/AD scrutiny. Instructions are provided to report ARSTALE-1's success in obtaining the visa and any relevant travel control events to TOD/AD.
title: Re: (Eshart Fauhrint) Operational/Emergency Passport in Alias for Use by ARSTALE-1 - AB Case No. 6937
